title: 2HELPS2B Score
description: Estimates seizure risk in acutely ill patients undergoing continuous EEG (cEEG). Combines clinical factors and EEG findings to guide appropriate monitoring duration.

parameters.name: seizure_history
parameters.description: History of seizures (remote or recent acute suspected)

parameters.name: epileptiform_discharges
parameters.description: Epileptiform discharges (spikes or sporadic sharp waves)

ranges.interpretation: Seizure risk in 72h: 5%. Only 1-hour screening EEG recommended. Additional monitoring generally not necessary.
Seizure risk in 72h: 12%. 12-hour cEEG monitoring recommended to detect non-obvious seizures.
Seizure risk in 72h: 27%. At least 24-hour cEEG monitoring recommended. Intensive neurological vigilance necessary.
Seizure risk in 72h: 50%. Prolonged continuous monitoring (â‰¥24h) highly recommended. Consider prophylactic anticonvulsant treatment.
Seizure risk in 72h: 73%. Mandatory prolonged continuous monitoring. Anticonvulsant treatment should be considered. Intensive neurological care.
Seizure risk in 72h: 88%. Continuous monitoring in neurological ICU. Anticonvulsant treatment frequently indicated. Reserved prognosis.
Seizure risk in 72h: >95%. Mandatory continuous monitoring in ICU. Urgent anticonvulsant treatment and neuroprotective measures. Severe prognosis.

references: Struck AF, Ustun B, Ruiz AR, et al. Association of an electroencephalography-based risk score with seizure probability in hospitalized patients. JAMA Neurol. 2017;74(12):1419-1424.
Struck AF, Osman G, Rampal N, et al. Time-dependent risk of seizures in critically ill patients on continuous electroencephalogram. Ann Neurol. 2017;82(4):177-185.
Gaspard N, Foreman BP, Judd LM, et al. Intravenous ketamine for the treatment of refractory status epilepticus: a retrospective multicenter study. Epilepsia. 2013;54(8):1498-1503.
formula: 2HELPS2B = (Seizure history: 1 point if present) + (Epileptiform discharges: 1 point if present) + (LPDs: 1 point if present) + (BIPDs: 1 point if present) + (BIRDs: 1 point if present) + (Burst-suppression: 1 point if present)
notes: Score developed to optimize continuous EEG (cEEG) monitoring duration
Should be calculated after the first hour of EEG, when >68% of abnormalities are evident
Combines one clinical factor (seizure history) with 5 electroencephalographic findings
Validated in large multicenter cohorts with >2000 patients
Precision medicine tool to personalize cEEG duration
Does not replace specialized neurological clinical evaluation
